Title: FreeRADIUS: Arbitrary code execution
Synopsis:
A vulnerability in FreeRADIUS can lead to arbitrary code execution
    or Denial of Service by authenticated users.

Background.Text: FreeRADIUS is an open source RADIUS authentication server.

Description.Text: Large passwords can trigger a stack-based buffer overflow in FreeRADIUSâ€™s rlm_pap module when authenticating against an LDAP server.

Impact.Text: An authenticated user could set a specially crafted long password, possibly leading to arbitrary code execution or a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All FreeRADIUS users should upgrade to the latest version:
